QAPair.Question: Do you have information about Blood sugar test - blood
QAPair.Answer: A blood sugar test measures the amount of a sugar called glucose in a sample of your blood. Glucose is a major source of energy for most cells of the body, including brain cells. Glucose is a building block for carbohydrates. Carbohydrates are found in fruit, cereal, bread, pasta, and rice. Carbohydrates are quickly turned into glucose in your body. This can raise your blood glucose level. The hormone insulin made in the body helps control the blood glucose level.
